Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, could work on service”
Reviews.Author: pkmiles
Reviews.Content: This is a really beautiful hotel. Very nicely designed in a contemporary, expensive way. We stayed in suite which was huge and lovely. It's the nicest Ritz Carlton we have stayed at. The lobby and public spaces are a dissapointment though. This hotel is conveniently linked via a passageway to the Marriott but they also rely on that a lot- meaning no business center in the ritz, you have to use the Marriott. Also, this hotel had the best burger from room service we ever had. My husband is a connoisseur of room service burgers and even I was impressed. Also, their bed was the most comfortable ever. Very quiet suite. The only downside was the sliding doors on bathrooms. This is a design trend we see everywhere now and they are particularly bad in this hotel. There is a huge gap even when the door is closed so you have no real privacy in the bathroom. You can hear everything and if you walking by, you can see into it too. Also, they need to work on service which in many cases is still on a Marriott level.

Reviews.Title: “WP 24”
Reviews.Author: ChiranujB
Reviews.Content: Wolfgang Puck newest Oriental cuisine! It serves the best Peking Duck, even for Oriental guests!! Other dishes are beef cheeks, dim sum, siu mai. Desserts are out of this world! The restaurant opens only at dinner time, closely watched by Wolfgang's friendly younger brother, Klaus. Menu is offered in set of 3 or 4 courses. On the 24th floor, the view of downtown LA next to The Staples Center is very nice. Allison is a lovely hostess.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Stephlino
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this ritz carlton. The rooms were so beautiful and elegant but still so cozy and warm. So spacious for a city hotel. The bathrooms were also huge with very modern touches. This hotel even had a doggy menu for their furry guests. The only negative about this hotel is the size of the lobby which isn't much of a negative. We did transfer to the ritz from the jw which is actually the same building but with different check in lobbies. The transition was smooth and they were very accommodating. The valet was great as well very patient and gracious we were able to transfer the valet information with changing from jw to the ritz without a problem or having to take out the car and check it in again under the new room ourselves which was great and a time saver. The bathrooms were unique in that the shower and bath tub were in the same area (you'll have to look at the pics to get a better understanding) It might have been a handicap room so i'm not sure if that was the reason or if they were going for a european thing. Anyways it was still pretty cool. The closet was located in the entry way and thats where the safe was as well as your essential for ironing and laundry bags. Another great touch was the espresso machine, instead of a regular coffee maker, which i LOVED. They had plenty of beverages to choose from the snack bar. They also provide complimentary waters, which they also hand to you at the valet (they come in handy on hot days) This was a really beautiful hotel with wonderful amenities! Another thing, their mattresses are amazing, i slept so well during my stay, even better then when I'm at home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mich99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business for 3 days in March. Service and accomodations were excellent. Just beware if there is a Lakers game at the Staples Center as it can be difficult to drive back to hotel when the game lets out and they close streets. You have to tell a traffic cop you are staying at the hotel so they will let you through.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: JorgeAMexicocity
Reviews.Content: The property its plenty of luxury, and the personal it's very kindly. My room was spectacular in 22th floor whith beatiful LA views. The Restaurant from Wolgang Puck was delicious with excellent menu and views. All the staff is very attentive and take care of you in all time.

Reviews.Title: “More like "Ritz Charlatan"”
Reviews.Author: goingoinggone
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at numerous Ritz-Carltons in the past (NYC, SF, Marina del Rey) and always considered them just a sliver downscale from Four Seasons. Based on this hotel, however, I would have to say that Ritz-Carlton has dropped, not one but several notches down that scale. I give it three stars because "poor" is an unfair rating. The hotel is new- just two years old, I was told - and very clean. They're marketing it as a "boutique" hotel, which to me is another way of saying they charge luxury rates for a cosmetically souped-up Hilton Garden Inn. I had reserved a Deluxe King room with my Platinum Amex, which guarantees an upgrade if available. No upgrade was offered at check-in so I asked and was immediately offered an Executive King room, but it seemed like an oversight that they didn't offer it automatically. The room required an elevator transfer, which underscored the somewhat wonky layout of this hotel. When I walked in the door to my room, I was truly (and not happily) surprised. The first thing I saw was a hideously cheap-looking light fixture:a prison-cell bulb suspended in a metal cylinder so rickity that it rattles continuously back and forth from the draft created by room's circulating air fan. The "drapes" are cafe rod curtains so flimsy that no matter how hard you try they cannot be drawn completely closed. They've basically used a minimalist Asian-inspired design motif as an excuse to cut every imaginable corner. I usually call Housekeeping to request turndown before I leave my hotel room for dinner, just to be sure the job gets done. There was no Housekeeping phone extension provided,so I just hoped for the best. Bad plan; no turndown service occurred. Is it possible that it's not even offered here? Trying to be fair, so a few redeeming features: the bathroom was ample and nicely designed. Soaking tub and walk-in shower share a nicely-designed enclosed space. Very nice and well-designed make-up mirror, and yes, to some of us, that matters. Complimentary Internet, which tells me they are trying to be relevant. And each staff member I encountered was truly genial and eager to please. They try, and almost succeed, to make up in service what this facility lacks in other areas. I was awakened at 6 am by a blaring alarm clock apparently set by some previous guest which was kind of a final straw/camel'sbackbreaker. This property shares a building with the Marriott and something tells me that I would find a better value there if I were to return. Ritz-Carlton should take this property off their list before patrons like myself take them off ours...

Reviews.Title: “If perfection can be achived”
Reviews.Author: zoe727
Reviews.Content: The property is absolutely beautiful but what is most impressive is the service amazing ,if you need pampering and to be taken care of then this is the place. Great food, excellent menu , lovely gift shop, I am in love Excellent for R&R , business, couples, familly and with the advent of proximity to LAX this my friends is a diamond.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worthy of Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: luxuryhotelcritic
Reviews.Content: In the last month I have stayed several times at the Ritz Carlton Los Angeles. With the exception of the club floor conciereges the hotel is not up to Ritz Carlton standards. The staff is not polished, cohesive or detail oriented and I would rate this hotel on par with a Marriott at best (probably not even a JW). Cold and uninterested in the guest is probably the best way to sum up two visits. Again, the Club Lounge was the exception. Rooms are "ok". Beds extremely comfortable and terriric. A lot of design glitches, particularly in bathroom. For example, although the "wet room" is a great concept, the shower cannot be turned on without being covered from cold water from the rain shower head above while waiting for hot water (which is just luke warm at best). Also, the bathroom sinks will splash your clothing even when turned on low. We had 2 rooms under 2 separate names booked. When our friends arrived at the hotel they walked into our room with the bellman and were actually assigned to our room even though we had already checked in and advised we were waiting for our friends! They were told my wife and I had not checked in when we had 1/2 hour prior with the same desk clerk and advised we were waiting for people. Not the end of the world, but just one example of lack of attention to simple details where this pseudo Ritz Carlton misses the mark. I would stay at this hotel again due to convenience to downtown venues and it is the best hotel in the area. However, I would advise management to polish the game quite a bit to be worthy of being part of the Ritz Carlton family and meeting the expectation and mark that Ritz Carlton guests have come to expcect. The hotel is gorgeous. The staff is the failure.

Reviews.Title: “Putzin at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: R0ckettWriter
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my 2-day "stay-cation" as I only live about 18 miles from downtown LA, but in LA, 18 miles is often an 1-1/2 hour drive so I haven't done as much downtown as one would think living this close to LA! This is a very classy hotel, nice large rooms and a fantastic spa. I had the deep tissue massage and Jeana did a very thorough job. The "sanctuary" and facilities in the spa were very appealing. The tea, ML, is extraordinary. I know that sounds silly, but it's true! There was an Herbal Life convention, so the hotel was full and the lobbies abounded with people from around the world. The pool deck offers a gorgeous view of the city. It's on the 25th floor. The Wolfgang Puck lounge is on the 24th floor. The location is right next to the Staples Center and across the street there's a Regal movie theater. We went to a play on the other end of town, but this Ritz has a town car that will drop you off or pick you up around the city from 8-11 a.m. and 5-8 p.m. We took a taxi back after the play. You can walk out the Ritz door and into a plaza with lots of restaurants. You can walk a few blocks to other restaurants. To get to "China Town" and "Little Tokyo" you can take a bus, taxi. Roy's Hawaian Restaurant is only aproximately 4 blocks away, maybe it's 5. Funny, but I noticed the same thing about the bathroom sink someone else mentioned in a review. The bathroom is beautiful -- but water does fly out of the sink so watch your clothes. As for the person who reviewed and was irritated that his room wasn't ready at 10 a.m., doesn't everyone know that a normal check-in time for a hotel is 3:00 p.m. in the U.S.? So personally, I think that guy is arrogant for expecting that. We actually did get an early check in, but around 2:00 p.m. We spend one afternoon at the pool and ordered the food on the phone. We were surprised the food was very good and they had nice healthy choices. We enjoyed our stay at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location!”
Reviews.Author: PDXTravelingGirl
Reviews.Content: Great location for activities/events at the Staple Center. The lobby area is a bit lacking in space however; and getting to the roof top deck is an 'elevator adventure'. The spa is lovely, and the service is at the Ritz Carlton level of exceptional. The bathroom sink is not ideal - there is a lot of water splashing from the way it's set-up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Beautiful Rooms, Terrible Service!”
Reviews.Author: mflan46
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel to check-in, you will notice that the lobby is almost nonexistent. There are two chairs, a concierge desk and the two person check-in desk. There was no champagne or pampered atmosphere as stated in other reviews. I was greeted by a front desk person who explained that my room was not ready, which I understood, as I was there at 10:00 am, however he was not at all accommodating. He asked for my method of payment, even though he was not checking me in (strange), and seemed inconvenienced when I asked to have my bags checked. I asked at that time if it was possible to get a pass to the concierge lounge, he corrected me by saying "We don't have a concierge lounge at the Ritz - we do however have a Club Room which you can be upgraded to when you check in". I found this to be very condescending and arrogant. It may be that I was dressed in workout gear as I was in town for a Fitness Convention, and that may have not fit in with the "LA Ritz" requirements. I often stay at 5-star hotels, and have never been treated so poorly. At that time, I asked that they call me when a room was available and left my phone number. He stated that they would put a rush on the room for me, which made me feel a little better. After checking my bags, I realized that I left my convention badge in my backpack, so I want back 5 minutes later and asked if they could grab my backpack so that I could get my badge out. The front desk person informed me that I would have to wait for the bellman to come up to the front to get it. When he checked my bag, the bellman did not check it, the front desk person did, and I assisted him with bringing it to the room directly behind the desk. There was no one in the lobby, so I asked if he could just grab my one small backpack, and he begrudgingly completed the task, which took less than 30-seconds. I thanked him and remedied him to let me know as soon as a room was available. I waited for a call to confirm my room was ready for 5 hours, and never received a call. So much for rushing the room for me. Either way, when I checked in, I was greeted by a more pleasant front desk person, who apologized for not calling me when my room was ready and proceeded to check me in. Again, he asked for my method of payment, and I informed him that I had already provided it. He apologized and said that it was not put into the system and that he had to take it again, making me wonder why the first person needed it. Check in went well (still no champagne), and I went to my room. The room was very well appointed, modern and clean. It was a fantastic room overlooking the swimming pool. This is what I was expecting from the Ritz! I have no complaints about the room at all. The walk-in shower, the amazingly comfortable bed, etc. all were up to 5-start standards! My group of 7 had dinner that night at Wolfgang Puck's 24, in the Hotel, which was amazing. The food was delicious, the service was impeccable and the view was beautiful. We secured a very private table, and enjoyed an amazing dinning experience. Upon getting ready to check-out, I called down to ask if transport was available to the hotel, and informed them that I needed a car for 6. They said no problem, just come down to the concierge and she will take care of it. When I came down, the concierge told me that it would be 45 minutes to get a limo. I told her that I would just call the Limo that I took in from the Airport as it was only $110 and they said they could pick me up with less than 30-minutes notice. She then told me that they had an Escalade available immediately and that it could easily take 6. I wound up waiting for 20 minutes for the Escalade, which did work fine for our group. When the driver dropped me off at the airport, I gave him my card to charge the ride on, and he stated that it was billed to my room. I asked if he knew what the rate was and he stated that he did not. To my surprise, I found that they charged my room $190 for the ride. $80 more than the limo I was going to get. I have no problem paying the expected amount for service, but I felt that this was very deceptive and the price should have been stated in advance, especially when I told her the rate we paid coming in. I feel that this Ritz is pretentious, and the service is not up to the standards set by the Ritz or other 5-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: dhaigh
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good location next to staples centre, Good rooms, Cant fault it.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: margarethouck
Reviews.Content: My 2-day weekend stay at the Ritz-Carlton LA could not have been better! The attention to detail was exactly what one expects from a 5-star hotel. From the glass of champagne at check-in, I was pampered and treated with the utmost care. I stayed on Floor #23, which was the Club Floor. The Club Room offers up sumptuous edibles all day, from a breakfast which included eggs and bacon, fruit, and every muffin and bakery item imaginable, to a lite supper which included meats, fish and poultry, as well as sides and salads. And don't pass up the fabulous selection of cookies and meringues on your way out the main Club entrance! Whenever I entered the Club Room, I was personally greeted, sometimes by name. I enjoyed taking most of my meals there, as well as popping in to grab a diet Coke or water, or to use one of the two computers located in an alcove. My room was not spacious, but the amenities made up for that. It included a 42" flat screen TV, ipod docking station, and other stereo components which I did not use; high-speed internet is offered for a fee. There were the obligatory self-serve mini-bar and refrigerator, as well as complimentary water, and coffee/espresso. The bathrooms were lovely, with walk-in shower, huge tub, and a TV screen built in to the mirror. The king-size bed and linens were exactly what one would expect at this hotel - luxurious, satiny and soooo comfortable. The only thing the room lacked was a larger closet; it accomodated my needs, as I was traveling solo. But it would have been cramped for two people. I spent Saturday morning at the 2nd floor spa, where I received the same personal greeting and attention to detail. I scheduled a lovely facial from Daniella, and a manicure/pedicure from Lillybeth, who was so funny and gracious. The spa is dressed all in white, with private rooms for each service offered. I left feeling really pampered! The lay-out of the Ritz-Carlton LA is a little different from most 5-star hotels. To start, it shares a high-rise with the Los Angeles Marriott, which takes up the first 20 or so floors. The hotel portion of the Ritz is on floors (approximately) 22-26, with the Ritz Carlton condominiums in the floors above that. Of course, you use high-speed elevators which take you directly to the Ritz-Carlton rooms from the small lobby. From the lobby you can walk through a corridor to the Marriott, which boasts a HUGE lobby area with an array of restaurants and bars. The entire Ritz/Marriott building is located directly across from Staples Stadium, the LA Convention Center, and the Nokia theatre. One other nice amenity is that the hotel has a Club Car for use by its patrons, free of charge. It will take you anywhere within a (I think) 5-mile radius of the hotel, first-come first-served. The resident restaurant for the hotel is WP24 (a Wolfgang Puck offering), which serves Asian-inspired cuisine. Additionally, there are restaurants of every offering and for every budget within walking distance of the hotel. There is also a 14-theater cinema complex directly across the street. My reason for staying at the Ritz was because I was attending 3 concerts in downtown LA (I'm a musician and Gustavo Dudamel enthusiast!). The Ritz location was perfect for my needs, and the ambiance was just right for a woman traveling solo. I will definitely be going again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tayfuns
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel,can't recommend it enough.good service ,comfortable rooms,friendly staff and it's in LA.what else can I say?!?!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Twohappygirls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ritz in downtown LA for two nights. The rooms were modern and beautiful, with wonderfully appointed bathrooms. We were on the club lounge floor(32) and took advantage of the lounge, which was well worth the extra cost, wonderful breakfast, and deserts are offered and the staff there is super friendly and helpful. Also unlimited drinks was a nice touch! The valets were helpful with directions and getting our car quickly. The only problem was the spa, I had needed to make an appointment, I called twice never getting a actual human just a voice mail. I left a number to contact me and never heard back, I actually had to contact the front desk to have them track someone down I the spa. I feel like the ritz charges a premium for their service and I felt although the service here was good, it wasn't quite up to other ritz properties I have stayed at. That being said I still would return to this hotel as the good far out weighed any bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: katastrophe1
Reviews.Content: Came for a girl's weekend - a nice hotel, but we didn't really use much of the amenities (of which there are few - no lobby at all, but it is attached to the Marriott and LA Live). Did walk up to the pool, which is beautiful, but it was a drizzly day so we didn't get to enjoy it. The rooms are pleasant and spacious, beds are comfy, and i love the TV in the bathroom mirror! The best part of the ritz experience is the service. The bellman went out of his way to walk us around, and we were always greeted by name. And they did mess up with a birthday cake order but more than made up for it by sending up complimentary champagne, cookies, and cheesecake at 2 in the morning after our night out.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary B
Reviews.Content: From the reception staff - where they greet you with a glass of Champagne - to housekeeping all the staff are friendly & helpful without being obsequious. They must have an amazing staff training program! The rooms are new & comfortable & the beds so great that my daughter wants one for home. We got a complimentary upgrade to club level where the views & food are great and the complimentary car service to within a 3 mile radius of the hotel is convenient - be aware however that it ends at 8pm so you have to find your own way back. Being located at LA Live is fun too , and check out the Music Museum around the corner. If you need to be in downtown LA this is the hotel to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: lozaman
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at a Ritz-Carlton was impressive. Upon arriveal no less than 3 people opened our doors, took our luggage, escorted us into the lobby, etc. The receptionist knew it was my wife's birthday and inisted on walking over to her and holding a personal conversation with her. Check-in was easy and fast. The elevators are private (room key access only). The room wasn't much larger than an oversized regular Marriott room but there were impressive upgrades, from the furniture to the bed, to the TV in the bathroom mirror (yes,in the mirror), also a roomy high-end shower. Everything was a cut above. The lounge/bar on the 24th floor had excellent appetizers, mixed-drinks and a world-class view of downtown LA. No complaints whatsoever. Highly-recommended for a weekend getaway, with tons of good restaurants nearby at LA Live.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alohacraig
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton at LA Live is world class. The hotel and it's staff are simply the best in Downtown Los Angeles. Check out WP on the 24th floor. Outstanding F & B..... I will be back in January.

Reviews.Title: “second and third visits”
Reviews.Author: tjs416
Reviews.Content: being in the sevice industry,you might enjoy this tale.. many years ago a physician complemented us on our service, but told us he would not tell any of his friends about how good it was and would not recommend us to anybody, because then our service would deteriorate and he would not get the service he had come to expect (we even delivered a mercedes covertible, complete with a red bow to his then second wife on christmas morning...but i digress) the ritz at la live just gets better and better, we arrived late saturday night, they greeted us by name and had my favourite corner room ready, once again, the whole experience was perfect, the lounge still stunning, the pool wonderful, the staff still exceptional....then we went for a small tour to the palm desert and san diego, planing to end up at the ritz at dana point, we didnt know that they, and another 5 million homes in southern california had lost their power and they didn't really want any new clients, so once again not knowing what to do and being in an awkward situation, we called the la live ritz, who were almost sold out, but told us to come and they would help, did they ever, a gorgeous suite on the club floor and a wonderful dinner recommendation at a nearby restaurant... every visit they are exceeding themselves, it is a just a perfect memory . it was my wife's first visit to the hotel and while I had told her how wonderful it was, she too felt that the level of service, the staff and the club floor were of exceptional quality. we'll certainly be back !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you have to stay downtown stay here...”
Reviews.Author: FoodloverLondon
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to go to the Emmys this weekend and stayed at the Ritz Carlton in one of the Club rooms. Perfect location for the Nokia Theatre and Governors Ball but wouldn't want to stay here unless I had to be downtown. The hotel is fabulous, roof top pool and jacuzzi, superb spa - thoroughly recommend the Champagne and Truffles body treatment. The Club facilities on 22nd floor were excellent - serving breakfast and lunch. Staff were courteous and couldn't be more helpful. Had a champagne reception at the Wolfgang Puck on the 24th floor - delicious canapes and a magnificent resto - would have liked to have eaten there. The rooms were lovely. However downtown is awful - no shops, no life. Not a place to go for a holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Don't get a room on 23rd floor”
Reviews.Author: myqueen21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and our first night, we heard people walking around and chairs squeeking sound all night long. Finally I couldn't take it anymore so I called downstairs and they told me that we are underneath their restaurant WP24. So next day, we were told that we can move so before we leave for our business, we packed some and they moved everything for us. But then again next morning we heard hammers banging early in the morning. We called downstaris again and was told that above floor is residencial space so they are doing renovation. I was getting irritated that this hotel is made with thin walls all over so that sound travels but this is no $200 hotel, it's $500 hotel. They garanteed us that workers won't be working next two days since it's weekend. They were offering their executive suite room for the price of reguler room if we wanted to move again, as well as first night they lower the rate 20% off and second night free. Despite their fault to have a restaurant right above guest rooms withourt carpet with horrible noise way into 2 AM, manager was really accomodating. Pne other irritating fact, their bathroom sink faucet is designed too high so when you use the sink water do splash all over your clothes and all over the sink so you have to wipe off the sink after you use it. This is brand new hotel, designers who design this hotel should check and make sure that everything works well before they choose the most good looking fauset from the showroom. They should not have guest rooms right under WP24 restaurants. Front desk staff told me that this has been their problem. Oh, one more thing, made service was not good at all, I have long hair and my hair remained in the bathroom floor for my entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: ayao001
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Stayed here on our last night in Los Angeles and absolutely loved it! Room: The room was modern, clean, felt very spacious and had a beautiful bathroom (even had a tv monitor in the mirror!). We were on a high floor so the view was also amazing at night! Service: We were treated like VIPs from the moment we got there. Every single person there was extremely friendly and helpful, from front desk to the bell boys, everyone was very professional. Room service: We didn't order room service at the hotel but they did have a cute pets menu! Only if we had our puppy with us. Location: The hotel is right opposite the staple centre, opposite a movie theatre, in the heart of downtown. Perfect for families, couples, and people working in downtown. If you are looking for a place to stay in downtown or still unsure where to stay in LA, PICK Ritz-Carlton. For the type of service, the convenience and the beautiful rooms, it's actually quite reasonably priced. Stay here and you will not regret your decision!

Reviews.Title: “It's a spectacular place”
Reviews.Author: MikeRe
Reviews.Content: After 24-hour journey the hotel was like a piece of heaven. The stuff is very professional and everyone is very friendly. Especially our luggage carrier Malik was a great guy. Even though it was supposed to be the smallest room they had it was pretty big and great in every aspect. The beds felt like sleeping on a cloud which was nice after the long flight. Located on 25th floor the room provided us with great views of the city. The bathroom had both shower and a bath (everything in marble) and there was even a built-in TV in the mirror. The pool is located on the 26th floor it's everything what you would expect from Ritz Carlton - Perfect. Only downside of the hotel is that the valet parking is pretty expensive. Otherwise everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and helpful people”
Reviews.Author: Woci
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because of their $299 weekend rate, which included a $50 credit for hotel services. Pluses were a really nice room, very accommodating staff, excellent gym, elaborate buffets in the lounge which the front desk gave us access to while we were waiting for the room to be cleaned as we checked in. Minuses were that there is a translucent glass separating the sleeping area from the bathroom, so that people in the bedroom can see people in the shower if the bathroom is lit and the room is dark. Also, one side of the building overlooks the Marrriott pool deck and Staples Center, where noise occurred from early morning to late evening. However, the hotel management took all steps to get venue organizers to quiet down, and also called to find a different room for us.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the Ritz Carlton Customer Service Promise”
Reviews.Author: TikkunOlam
Reviews.Content: Check-in to check-out, we were treated royally. They are so accommodating, it's a pleasure to stay there. Our room had a great view of LA Live and we were able to watch some of the X Games from our window. There's plenty to do in that area, but the location is not convenient to other tourist attractions. Oh well, can't have everything. Note: we used points for this stay, which is why I'm not sure of the value.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Downtown Los Angeles Property”
Reviews.Author: TheHonestWord
Reviews.Content: Being it one of the newer properties in the downtown area, The Ritz Carlton at LA Live is a solid choice for anyone look to retreat in comfort. It is levels above the JW Marriott at LA Live (Yes, both Ritz & JW are both Marriott brands) but the JW in the same building feels like it will get dated fast. The Ritz on other the hand transforms the rooms into something that will rival any other downtown properties. Service is top notch, being offered champagne upon arrival and a full personal rundown of the property from the managers at the front desk upon arrival; they want to make you feel like you a being taking care of with primo service. I don't see this as a destination retreat, more of a high class urban shelter for those attending events in the immediate area. It's a little pricey but if you have to choose between JW and the Ritz, the Ritz wins hands down for high end comfort & personal service. They've won me over and I definitely will be back if I'm in the downtown area... Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: lizegg
Reviews.Content: I'm not a Ritz regular, but for my first experience at the hotel, this was fantastic. Service was excellent, and all the perks the Ritz offers makes the stay even more enjoyable. Our room easily fit 5 people, using two queens and the twin size futon. The rooms were on the larger side, the bathroom pristine. The rooftop pool is this hotel's main attraction, and we spent plenty of time there in the hot tub, salted pool, or cabanas. The fitness room was nice, and everything you need is right there--headphones, warm-scented towels, apples, water bottles, along with plenty of workout equipment. Would love to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Service now tops for Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: dsweet
Reviews.Content: I read the early reviews of this hotel and hesitated some before booking a club level room at the terrific (less than JW Marriott) American Bar Association rate. Upon arrival, I found that the facilities were excellent, as advertised. The club level lounge was the most visually appealing of any RC that I have booked. My upgraded executive room was very large, and the corner location had spectacular 23rd floor views. The surprise was that the level of attention to detail, the friendliness, and the availability of staff not only met Ritz Carlton standards, but exceeded them. In fact, I would rate the service level as similar to those of the top Hotels in Asia. For example, when I asked how to get to LA Live, the front desk person not only walked me to it, but provided free Grammy museum tickets! On the first night, I ordered a second top sheet, which was not only delivered instantly, but was refreshed nitely. The lounge staff could not have been more friendly or helpful, and my request for 2pm checkout was honored. Dinner at WP24was expensive but exceptional. For those who found the service level initially lacking, I recommend a second chance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Clinton S
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about a 300 room Ritz-Carlton adjacent to the Staples Center and the JW Marriott, a 1000 room hotel. However the room was one of the nicest Ritz rooms I have visited in my 28 years of staying off and on in Ritz Carlton hotels. The service was excellent, private Ritz entrance nice, and being adjacent to the Staples Center, LA Live and all the restaurants great. I definitely would stay here again...much more fun than I thought. I did not like the $40 price tag on the valet parking...I think that is way too much but knew that when I booked the room.

Reviews.Title: “First Class all the way!”
Reviews.Author: travelclassygal
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here while doing college visits in June. It was very clean, we splurged for the club level and it made our life so easy. When we were ready to head out to our next adventure, we stopped by the lounge grabbed a tea,coffee or water bottle and left. When we were on our way back in, grabbed fruit or a snack. They always had nice food presentation and were always pleasant. The hotel was clean/nice/new.The only glitch was a fire alarm early one morning where we climbed down 24 flights of stairs only to find out if was a false alarm. I felt like someone should have yelled in the stairwell that it was false. It wasnt very comfortable walking in the Ritz Lobby in your pajamas. Great location if you have a car. The concierge was eager to plan and help.I think her name was Patrice. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Ratings When First Opened”
Reviews.Author: NextChapterTraveller
Reviews.Content: I've heard lots of negative reviews about this property when it first opened because it was not up to par with the Ritz Carlton brand. Kinks are to be expected from any business - I think since that time, their front line staff must have gotten a hang of their roles. I found the service was great and what you would normally expect from a 5 star hotel. One thing that previous guests have discussed before that cannot changed is the layout of the property. It is connected to the JW Marriot which is sprawling in comparison. Their lobby is grand and filled with attendants. In fact, my taxi dropped my off at JW's lobby, I guess they think the two properties are synonymous with each other? If you do get dropped off at the JW, you will need to walk through a tiny little hallway on the left hand side to get to the Ritz. The lobby there is very small in comparison but cozy. You can already see from all the other travellers photos the decor - Very new, modern and top notch - is true to life, so I won't comment on it. I will have to say that the washrooms are EXCELLENT. The washroom is split in 2 so It has a separate toilet and bath area - perfect for couples who need room to each do their own thing :) The shower area features a rain shower and SUPER CLEAN tub. There are rarely any hotels that have tubs clean enough for a bath for my standards but this has got to be one of them so that says a lot about the cleanliness of this property. It's right next to the Nokia and Staples Centre. Immediately downstairs you will find many mid-price eateries to grab a bite. Most are your typical bar-food. They also offer an In-House DRIVER and towncar which will take you out within the local area - but no returns back to the hotel. They don't take reservations but you can simply call the front desk and ask if the car is available and they will let you know when is a good time to go down to the lobby to wait for the drivers return. For quick cheap eats nearby I would give it a 4/5 For washroom cleanliness I would give it a 5/5

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lak54
Reviews.Content: Great Service, Proffesionalism. Location, very well trained staff

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property.”
Reviews.Author: Norgetroll
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many Ritz Carltons around the country, and this did not disappoint. Service was perfect from check in to check out. Front desk staff greeted us by name. Was presented with champagne. Children welcomed and also offered drinks. Room was very modern, but still warm. Beautiful modern bathroom. Kids loved TV in mirror. Was on 23 floor and views were super. Be sure to pay the up grade for Club Lounge. The $70 or so extra is well worth it. Four services a day. We ate breakfast, lunch, and dinner in lounge. Were out of hotel for dessert service sadly. Staff in lounge and all over the hotel were very polite and helpful. Pool area is nice, but was windy for our stay. Cabanas very nice. There is a pool side bar, we did not need as had club lounge, but waitress seemed very gracious. Husband and kids used the fitness center both mornings. We did not eat in the restaurant as we were out both evenings. Freeway access was very easy for getting around. Kids liked movie theater just across the street. Parking fee was $32 dollars a night and internet was $12.95 a day. We will return to this hotel when we are in town this summer.

Reviews.Title: “So this is what 5 Star looks like!”
Reviews.Author: Mystelody
Reviews.Content: I booked one night as a birthday gift to my bf who generally insists on having the finer things in life and boy was it fine! The room was spacious. There is a TV embedded in the bathroom mirror, the bathroom has both a big tub and rain shower head, the decor is very modern/contemporary, someone from front-desk walked us up and gave us a mini tour of the room, a personal kit including a toothbrush and room sandals were provided, the bottled water was free and valet offers you even more water before you leave (seriously, a bottle of water costs about 25 cents, why don't all hotels offer just a basic free bottle of water to guests?) Anyway, all the luxury did cost quite a bit but this was a gift so I sucked it up! The location is in the LA Live area which pretty much represents LA as most visitors imagine it to be. If you can afford it, stay at the Ritz Carlton over and over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility; gracious and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: aaflyer3M
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Ritz-Carlton properties often, and selected this property because of its location and that it was a new hotel. It was superb in every aspect. The reception desk person greeted me by name and was very helpful in providing a wonderful room. The club staff were, to a person, genuinely welcoming and gracious. There are many choices in hotels in the LA area. I would recommend this hotel as one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Am still talking about it (in a good way)”
Reviews.Author: tjs416
Reviews.Content: Landed in LA (Los Angeles for those not in the know) due to passport difficulties. An idyllic location. From the moment I walked in they made me feel welcome. The upgraded room view overlooking the Hollywood Hills was amazing. The club lounge was one of the best I've ever been to (trust me I'm not Charlie Sheen but I've seen a few). The outdoor pool is fabulous, and the staff truly exceptional. They catered to my every request. Thankfully it was within walking distance of the Canadian consulate. They did indeed offer me a complimentary mercedes limo daily, but I declined rather enjoying the Los Angeles air quality.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurios Hotel in Downtown L.A.”
Reviews.Author: Anschi3108
Reviews.Content: The hotel is highly recommendable for both tourists and visitors of the city as well as for a business trip. It opened up in April 2010 and has 123 rooms. The hotel is located in a tower that offers a great view over Downtown L.A. I really liked the size of the rooms with huge panorama-windows and the bathroom with TV and a really cool bath tub In the hotel you can also find the restaurant WP24 which is created by Wolfgang Puck. The hotel is right next to the JW Marriott Los Angeles Hotel and in walking-distance of the L.A. Convention Center. Also nearby are the STAPLES Center, Nokia Theatre L.A. LIVE, The GRAMMY® Museum and an array of restaurants, venues and nightspots. Hence I can recommend it for both tourists and business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton at LA Live”
Reviews.Author: LJBL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have only good things to say about the new Ritz Carlton in Los Angeles. Our experience started with prompt and professional valet service. We arrived somewhat early and we were immediately shown to a 3 room 1200 sq ft Executive suite on the Club Floor. Club access allowed us a nicely done buffet breakfast, lunch and after dinner desserts. Cocktails, champagne and wine were provided whenever we wished. The friendly club floor concierges were very welcoming and knowledgable and made us feel right at home. Wolfgang Puck's new restaurant, WP24 was an excellent place to have dinner. It's on the 24th floor, thus the name, with spectacular views of downtown LA skyscrapers. The food was imaginative and consisted of tasty chinese and other asian dishes. Both the decor and menu made dinner at WP24 a memorable nice experience. LA Live itself is a new downtown location surrounded by many different entertainment venues. There are restaurants, an ice skating rink for the holiday season, The Nokia Theatre and The Grammy Museum which had very interesting exhibits featuring John Lennon, Janis Joplin and The Doors among many others. Nice seeing Jim Morrison's boy scout card and his driver's license picture from 1967. We're in Los Angeles a few times a year and the Ritz Carlton at LA Live is our new destination. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the valet service and facility left me shaking my head”
Reviews.Author: M_Harley
Reviews.Content: I was booked for one night at the Ritz-Carlton, Los Angeles, on November 16 for business. When I drove into the valet driveway (3:30 PM), there was nobody in sight. I proceeded to unload my three bags from my SUV myself... until someone finally asked about my car (that wasn't until I was in the lobby waiting in line for the front desk). Strike one. My room was on the 25th floor, requiring a transfer to a second elevator each time I went up and down (the lift from the lobby only goes to the 24th floor). Strike two. While the room was beautiful and well appointed, there was no electrical outlet near the desk and the WiFi was intermittent (both critical for business travelers). Strike three. Lastly, it took several very long minutes to get hot water to the shower in the morning. Strike... um, four. On a positive note, all staff that I actually interacted with were very friendly and nice... and the rooms were very comfortable... but I expected more from a modern Ritz-Carlton property.

Reviews.Title: “Club Lounge improves second stay”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second time over the Labor Day weekend. We were able to get a decent rate using the Ritz's Reconnect package. Note rates here and at the adjacent JW Marriott are highly dependent upon events scheduled at the nearby Staples Center, Nokia Theatre, and LA Convention Center. Our stay, for instance, was sandwiched between the Primetime Emmy Awards and the MTV Video Awards shows at the Nokia. Our first stay was fine (see prior review), but this one was even better. It seems like there has been additional staff training since our first visit, because overall staff attitude has improved. Dual doormen and dual reception desk staff (one is a concierge) greet you as you enter, other staff all greet you as you pass by in the halls, at the pool, at the fitness center. The one front desk person who I remembered gave me misinformation previously, I avoided. The biggest difference with this visit was access to the Club Lounge, a $70 value that is well worth it if you are available everyday for each of the 4 daily food presentations, which we were for this reconnect/disconnect/do nothing weekend. The presentations include: 1) Breakfast, with 2 hot selections, one usually oatmeal, and a wide variety of fresh fruit, carbohydrates (breads, cereals, danish, muffins, etc.) and proteins (hard-boiled eggs, smoked salmon, sliced meats). 2) Mid-day meal, with a selection of gourmet petite sandwiches (including one vegetarian and one seafood), and veggies/salads, plus fabulous house-made potato chips and more. 3) Hors d'oeuvres/cocktails, a selection of dainty small bites, plus 2 hot selections like empanadas, coconut shrimp, and again those fab chips. 4) Desserts/aperitifs, again a selection of dainty bites, including chocolate lollipops. The Lounge staffers are a hardworking bunch of multi-taskers who serve simultaneously are concierges, hosts, waiters, buspeople, bartenders, and food and beverage restockers. For this weekend, the Lounge was busy but not overwhelmingly so, and there were almost no business people. There were usually 2 staff working at a time. The Lounge is a large, comfortable space with sofas, tables and chairs, a private meeting room, multiple TVs and computers. An entire wall of windows faces west, where the Pacific can be glimpsed on a clear day. There are several jars filled with cookies at the door. Dinner is the only meal you have to think about with Lounge access. We dined, once again, at the hotel's WP24 (as in Wolfgang Puck), a fancy Asian place which now has prix-fixe pricing, and also tried the nearby Rivera (chef John Rivera Sedlar, who we remember years ago from the restaurant St. Estephe), which has 4 menus of Latin cuisine served in 3 dining areas. The physical idiosyncrasies of the hotel remain: the tiny lobby, the lack of a bar or meeting area for business, the modern design/decor some find incongruous with the Ritz name. For me, these issues are neither here nor there. Note, Club access is for double occupancy; there may be additional fees if extra people, be they family or business associates, are brought in. I noticed that the hotel no longer puts out a selection of newspapers by the elevators in the morning, although the Club Lounge does (one is also delivered to your room). One morning I think the LA Times delivery was late, so a copy of the paper printed entirely off a computer was delivered instead. Also, the DVD player connection to the TV was confusing, necessitating 2 visits from an engineer. Judging from TA reviews, it seems this new hotel got off to a bit of a bumpy start. Our second visit made it clear the staff has taken heed and has made efforts to improve. This is one of the closest hotels distance-wise that we have chosen for a staycation, and one we will continue to consider in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: pppp4040
Reviews.Content: If you want a great hotel in downtown LA then this is it. A great place to stay, rooms are fab, beds great, service good. We stayed in club and it was one of the best we have been to. A massive room well fitted out with leather chairs etc, great food and drink. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “This is a business hotel, not a luxury...”
Reviews.Author: Gandaratravels
Reviews.Content: This is a business hotel, not a luxury experience. The service is unpolished and the food is terrible. The pool is small and shabby. There are so many nicer places to stay in LA--and so many less expensive hotels in downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ZM73
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and recommend it wholeheartedly. First and foremost, the staff were among the friendliest we have ever encountered. It was a breath of fresh air and a stark contrast to experiences at other hotels. Our room was clean, spacious and very comfortable. With its large windows throughout, the hotel offers panoramic views of the city. Day and night, it was something to behold - even from the bathroom. The lobby is tiny, but works very well for its function of checking guests in and out. The large JW Marriott lobby is steps away and has all the regular lobby accoutrements. You can pay extra for access to the Club Lounge, where there are drinks, delicious food and wall-to-wall northwest views. It has a relaxing atmosphere and we loved sitting by the window with cocktails. We had drinks and appetizers at the lounge in WP24, the restaurant on the 24th floor, and it was terrific. The spa was very good and the pool area, being so high up, feels otherworldly. We thought this hotel would be worth a try and it exceeded every expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced. Service is slow. Stay at the JW Marriot nearby. Better value”
Reviews.Author: Trip718
Reviews.Content: Took 2 hours to get a charger that should have been in the room Any request takes awhile to get processed. They must be understaffed at this location I don't think it's worth the price. Management needs to work out the kinks Breakfast was excellent. The free internet did not work. I don't think the front desk entered my name into the system correctly

Reviews.Title: “Drinks at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: DWU35
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to stay at this hotel since they opened and finally got a chance to do so while traveling through the area with a friend! From the moment we checked in we were greeted with spectacular sevice. The rooms are beautifully appointed and have all the amenities one could want. The spa is top notch and for what you get reasonably priced. However the one thing that made our stay the most memorable was when we ordered drinks at the roof top pool. A year prior at the Berlin location i had been recomended a drink and when i ordered it agin despite no one knowing what it was they were qick to figure it out and get it to me! We were also fortunate enouf to be there the night of the VMA's!

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical grand Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: vorsoni
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay downtown LA this is a great hotel but don't expect the grand Ritz Carlton you might have experimented elsewhere! No lobby so to speak and no restaurant. No breakfast either. They send you to the connected hotel next door (the JW). Very weird feeling when meeting business partners. On the bright side the rooms are nice, staff is very friendly and helpful, and the rooftop swimming pool is something you can't miss.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: zanadu34439
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Ritz for 2 nights and was very impressed by the courtious staff and luxurious hotel room. The pool deck was absolutely unbelivable and exclusive, a oasis. The new wolfgang puck restaurant is a must do, pricery but a great experience. I highly recommend you pay the few extra dollars to get access to the Club level, this is pure luxury and one gets pampered with amazing service and very great value of food and wine. Yes the lobby is small, but I usually dont hang out at the lobby anyways. Everything else at this hotel and the location is brilliant. highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: amlash
Reviews.Content: I am happy to finally have a decent place to stay in downtown LA! The Ritz Carlton is a sleek, spanking-new property well located in the downtown area. I was in a standard King room that was commodious and well appointed. The bed was heavenly and the large bath was a delight. The only drawback is the lack of a Lobby. The entrance from the street is small and resembles an office building. There is a small desk with helpful staff, but there is no central meeting place where one can meet colleagues, or attend to other travel-related businesses.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you,Ritz Carlton for making my daughter's 21st birthday a very special day in her life.”
Reviews.Author: Rocket8810
Reviews.Content: We have traveled all over the world and stayed at numerous hotels such as the Ritz, Four seasons, Plaza NYC and JW Marriott. Luxury hotels have all the similar qualities, such as Club rooms, executive suites, etc. The difference is the services.I would like to take this opportunity to express my heartfelt thanks to the staff for the excellent service in our recent visit to the Ritz Carlton Los Angeles. The passion our guest relations Rachelle have for her job reflects in the way she treats her guests and we are very lucky to have had her service. Rachelle is truly an asset for any corporation and I cannot thank her enough for the time and dedication she spent in making my daughter's 21st birthday a very special day in her life.

Reviews.Title: “Abysmal”
Reviews.Author: martberson
Reviews.Content: Let's make it short and sweet. Two nights, and a thousand dollars poorer. Rooms lacked cleanliness, service from start to finish was non-existent, the cost of valet was close to $50 a night, and loud neighbors. The only thing that showcases this as a Ritz property is the name. Should have stayed at a Holiday Day Inn Express and saved the cost of our plane tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect from the Ritz, just stay at the Mariott”
Reviews.Author: onimity
Reviews.Content: I have had phenomenal experiences at Ritz Carlton hotels worldwide, but this hotel is a disappointment. The service was great upon check-in, but the lobby is tiny and has no real place to sit when waiting for someone (at least not if anyone else is in it) and the service is only mediocre...usually the best part of the Ritz experience. The coffee machine in my room doesn't work, and the front desk didn't bother to pick up the phone when I called about the problem TWICE. No evening turn-down service as promised. The housekeeping was so-so, my shower had a lot of mineral buildup on it and other people's hand prints would show up when it got steamy. I realize that lots of other people have used the shower, but I don't really want to see visual evidence of it. There is nothing special about this hotel and while it would be a decent experience for a Sheraton it is not by any means a 5-star experience nor is it worth the extra money over any of the other mid-range hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Service & Guest Relations”
Reviews.Author: wesprs
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews below, it seems there is a trend. I didn't even have to stay at the hotel, nor will I ever, to write this review. I called to arrange a bottle of champagne for a birthday gift upon my parent's arrival for their one night stay . The request, which seemed easy enough, was put through days before arrival and promised with no issue. After calling to confirm the delivery of the gift on the day of arrival, the order was no where to be found or processed and I was told that they would "investigate" the guest relations manager at the time I placed the order.... i thought, OK, you want to get to the core of your internal staff issues... but what are you going to do for the customer? After 5 or 6 calls later, the Guest Relations manager tells me that the order was finally uncovered (probably on a sticky note of some sort), but that it was cancelled claiming that my parents changed their reservation name upon check in, so they then resorted to say that it was not completely their fault due to this alteration. Right... so part of the dilemma is now on my shoulders because their was a simple name change upon check-in? They checked in didn't they? Change the room # on the delivery and make it happen. Coming from a Ritz Carlton... I found this unacceptable... I expect this level of excuse and service from a Marriott or Sheraton but not the Ritz. Two pieces of advice for the Ritz... 1. Customer Service is golden. You are in the business of servicing guests. That is all. Don't make excuses, just make it right. 2. Hire staff to the standards of your business. I've been to several Ritz Carltons all over the world, and to find this level of service with a new location is unreal when in comparison to the rest. Invest in some quality control management

Reviews.Title: “stay here with an open mind and bring your patience”
Reviews.Author: luv2traveltheworld65
Reviews.Content: this is not your typical ritz carlton in any way. it is not at all traditional and the service is inconsistent at best. if you are looking for a traditional ritz carlton experience with top notch customer service, be forewarned, you will not find it at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Fine new hotel”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: We had been planning an in-town getaway at the Ritz since its opening in April. We had to cancel our first reservation back then, but for the July 4 weekend, rates were the lowest we've seen. The Ritz and the adjacent, connected JW Marriott (the hierarchy of hotels in the Marriott group is Ritz Carlton, then JW Marriott, then Marriott) are 2 hotels in the LA Live "campus"--a dining and entertainment complex adjacent to the LA Convention Center, Staples Center (home of the LA Lakers and other sports teams, plus a concert venue), and the Nokia Theatre, a smaller venue for live performances. It is not unlike Citywalk at Universal Studios. The LA Live website states the larger Marriott (873 rooms) is geared towards conventioneers and tourists, with the much smaller Ritz (123 rooms) for visiting sports teams, entertainers and their entourages, and executives. The outside hotel signage is a bit misleading. The shorter building is topped with the Marriott sign, while the taller tower says Ritz Carlton and has a rooftop heliport. In fact, both hotels are contained within the first 26 floors of both buildings, with the upper floors of the 54 floor tower housing Ritz Carlton Residences priced at near $900,000 and up. The Marriott occupies floors 4-21, with the Ritz on floors 22-26. The hotels are connected on the first 3 floors. The Marriott's pool deck is on level 4, the Ritz's on floor 26. The Marriott's lobby is of course much larger, with a restaurant, lounges and coffee bar. The Marriott also has many meeting rooms and a huge 3 level ballroom/convention complex. The Ritz's lobby is tiny, with a single sofa and chair and a 2 person counter for front desk and concierge staff. When the Ritz first opened a few months after the Marriott, room rates were well over $100 more costly. Even valet parking was more expensive ($50 vs. $38). For whatever reasons, the Ritz has somewhat reduced its rates, and valet parking now costs the same. Realize rates and availability at both hotels varies considerably based on what's going at the Convention Center and Staples (no rooms were available during the recent NBA finals), but for the July 4 weekend, Ritz's rates were a mere $20 more than Marriott's. This was in spite of a huge Japanese Anime convention being held at the Convention Center as well as the Marriott--tons of costumed young folks everywhere. We fluctuated between booking the I Love LA Live package (includes 10% off all dining and beverage outlets, free valet parking, and 2 free tickets to 2 LA Live venues of your choice--package also available at the Marriott), and getting access to the Club Lounge with its 5 daily food presentations. We opted for the I Love LA package after we were able to secure a pretty coveted dinner reservation for WP24, Wolfgang Puck's newest Asian restaurant and lounge on the 24th floor (I think anytime you can get a discount at a Wolfgang Puck place, it's a good thing). Note that unlike other Ritzes where the Club Level Lounge and rooms are on their own floor, this Ritz has no dedicated club level rooms, since there are only 4 floors of rooms--rather, you pay extra ($70) to get access to the Club Lounge on floor 23. I think everyone is asked at check-in if they want to upgrade, so technically 100% of the guests could have Lounge access. We called ahead to see if early check-in was available, and it was. The valet, bellmen, doormen and front desk staff were all courteous and attentive at all times. We did encounter some inconsistent service primarily when it came to knowing what our package included. When I asked a telephone reservation agent about the package before we booked, she had to put be on hold for so long I had to hang up. One concierge was also unfamiliar with all aspects of the package, and the 10% dining discount was not adjusted off at check-out until we asked. Also, the free valet parking is for one day only--a detail not mentioned previously. The Ritz has a definite water theme and slight Asian theme. We were given a room facing south, with views of the Marriott pool and the LA Live Nokia Plaza and Staples Center. East-facing rooms have similar views, while north-facing rooms overlook the Harbor Freeway and tall downtown LA office buildings. West-facing rooms see Century City office towers in the distance, as well as the Hollywood sign. A room key is needed in the elevators to access room floors and also to access rooms on the 24th floor where WP 24 is. Note that the 25th floor rooms and 26th floor pool deck and fitness center require using a second, separate elevator. The hotels share a business center on the 3rd floor that has daytime hours only and is closed on Sunday. Outside the business center are 3 computers that require a credit card, but Ritz guests can log in a secret access code for complimentary use. The Spa is on the 2nd floor and available to both hotels. The room, a standard Deluxe King, was nicely done, but seemed smaller than its reported 450 square feet (vs. 375 feet at Marriott). The wood paneled carpeted entry way has a sliding wooden door to the bath. Next there is a white lacquered wood floored dressing area with closet, mirror and shelf. You then enter the bedroom, which has a sofa by the window, glass table/desk, flat screen HD TV, DVD player, minibar, espresso maker. The bath had 2 sinks, an enclosed WC, and one of those combination shower-tub rooms that seem to be popular in newly constructed hotels--you walk through the shower to reach the tub. This was our first experience with this design; my first thought was that housekeeping has to clean the tub even if its not used, since using the shower wets the tub. I liked the set-up, since it makes for a roomier shower space than the often cramped shower in traditionally separated showers and tubs. The shower has a rain head and hand-holdable head. WP24 was fabulous. You first pass though the uniquely designed lounge to the smaller, more traditionally designed dining room. Both have great views. The food is Asian, tastes are often familiar, but amped up to the highest level in terms of ingredients, flavour, execution, presentation and service. Some thing are quite spicy. Cocktails delicious. Lee Hefter, original chef at Spago Beverly Hills and now a Managing Partner with the Puck group, was present. I 'm sure he had much input in the restaurant's menu planning, as he has traveled extensively in Asia. WP24 is the Ritz's only restaurant and lounge. The hotel guide in our room says it is open for breakfast and lunch, but this is not the case, nor does it seem feasible. Thus, the Club Lounge is really the only space for the business traveler who must conduct meetings on site. The Marriott has Kerry Simon's LA Market Restaurant that reportedly has a good breakfast buffet, but we did not try it. LA LIVE has scores of dining options as well. We chose to breakfast at a place from our past--The Original Pantry Cafe one block north--a traditional diner open 24 hours since 1924. Besides the LA Live campus, there's not much to do in the immediate vicinity--the attractions of downtown LA are a bit further north, as are numerous hotels, including a traditional Marriott and the historic Biltmore. But this is a good central location from which to travel in any direction. We would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed also…”
Reviews.Author: Member in Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: We chose the RC as I was attending a four day conference at the convention center and its location couldn’t be beat. As others have said, as a business hotel, they are totally unprepared. As a luxury hotel they also fall short compared to either Four Seasons in town. I fully understand fully that this is a very newer property and is no doubt undergoing some opening glitches. However, I could argue that a property like this should be launched only when the staff is 100% up to speed and if that delays an opening by several weeks, so be it. Additionally, I assume that this property was opened with a staff specifically hired and trained for this property. With that in mind I would say our stay was a lot rougher around the edges than I would consider acceptable for a RC. I booked through Platinum American Express (AE) travel services and was told at the time of booking the AE amenities offered by this property. Upon arrival we were taken to the club lounge for check in where the desk person was initially unable to locate our reservation. Once they did there was no mention of any AE-related amenities and when I asked about them, none of the club staff had a clear idea what they were. I recounted what I recalled from my conversation with the AE agent who made my reservation and go a tentative “that sounds right.” They made no offer to confirm the specifics and get back to us. To be sure, we later asked at the main desk and were given equally vague answers and in the case of the spa credit, incorrect information that we only discovered upon check out. I don’t think I should have to call AE to confirm what my reservation includes. The rest of our stay, from the doormen who never seemed to be near the door, to the indecisive main desk staff who more often then not didn’t even look up when you passed, or the club level staff who never seemed willing to go “any” let alone that extra mile, lacked the sharp edge I would expect, a result of “not quite” staff training I suspect. The rooms themselves (we had a corner room on 24) have some issues. As mentioned, there is no desk lamp, rather a ceiling light mounted in the center of the room behind the desk chair 5’-6” off the floor that you constantly have to dodge or hit your head on (I’m 6’-1”) and few and completely ill-placed outlets. Also, maybe it was because it was a new property but the material selection for the wardrobe closet may have been a poor one. The resinous material smelled extremely noxious and chemical-like. This odor would impregnate anything that we hung in it thereby rendering the closet useless, a problem for a 4-night stay. It may dissipate from the piece over time but for now I would call it a problem. Also, I know I’m in the minority in this but I am so not loving the new trend in hotel room design of the shower/tub combo room. This RC is not alone in this odd style this one is better than most but it is really neither practical nor functionally IMO. Sorry but to me it is just trendy and awkward. Overall, the hotel presents itself as a Marriott in a tuxedo. The design and style is a notch above a newer Marriott but in this particular property, the extra service that I would expect the staff to deliver that separates a RC from a Marriott is weak or completely missing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good hotel, Too much money.”
Reviews.Author: WayneBullet
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carlton says it all right there. They are known for being the best of the best. I had never stayed at one before. It was right in the thick of things for LA Live. Which is basically why they got a 3 out of 5 for me. Had they not been, I would not have given them that good of a rating. This is the first time that I spent close to $600 a night for a room. I was expecting more for that kind of money. It was actually $549 a night but then they nail you for parking $38 a day. Then Wifi another $12 a day. They offered some club thing that I did not partake in that was $70 a day. We used their parking, great job. Quick with the car. We check in. Nice job. We get to the elevator and can't get to our room. She forgot to make our door cards capable of working with the elevator and doors to our room. You need a valid door card to get to your floor. We get to our room and had to wait for our luggage. Probably about 15 minutes. We needed them to make a few changes. The lights in the room are confusing as hell. There are lights all over the place but the switches do not seem to work with the logical light. You hit one switch by a lamp and it turns on the light in other end of the room. You hit the switch on the other end and it lights the light up by the door. The guy who brought up the luggage was awesome, very helpful. He directed us to the ESPN Zone. Helped with bags very nice. They only have 1 restaurant in the hotel and it was closed to a party. Pool was very nice with a cool view. LA LIVE was very cool. If you are going to an event down there, this place would be a great fit. Only reason I have a problem with the place is the price. Honestly I have stayed at just as nice and same quality of customer service for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not Ready for the Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: MisstheDogs
Reviews.Content: First, there are many positives about the Ritz. It is located directly next door to LA Live, making it very convenient to the Staples Center as well as all of the other shops and amenities in the vicinity. Check-in was very quick and I was given exactly the room I requested. The rooms themselves are modern, large, and generally well appointed. The bathroom is huge, with a unique shower/tub arrangement -- they are separate but right next to each other. The rooms overlook LA LIve and, because they are all on high floors, the views are quite good. The bed was very comfortable. Rooms have a mini-bar, although I was never able to locate a price list. Now, for the negatives. I was traveling on business, so the first thing I wanted to do was plug in my computer at the desk. However, there was no electrical outlet to be found anywhere near the desk. The closest one was more 10' away next to the coffee maker. (There as also no desk lamp and no phone at the desk.) The only other plugs I found in the room were: one right inside the main door and four in the bathroom. When I called the front desk to ask if I simply wasn't seeing the outlet (if it was perhaps located behind a panel, etc.), I was told that no one had ever made this complaint before. I later learned that there were no other accessible outlets in the room. I had some internet connectivity issues. They did offer to send someone to my room but it was late and, ultimately, I told them not to bother given the lateness of the hour. I did look for the ethernet cable (which the guest directory said was available) on the theory that a wired connection might be more "stable." Not only did I never find the cable but, if I had, there was no place in the room in which to plug it. The elevator situation was also a bit annoying. Although the hotel is very tall, most of the floors are filled with condos/apartments. The hotel itself is limited to floors in the lower 20s. However, in order to access your room, you must change elevators on the 22nd (or maybe 21st) floor. I was told by the bellman that the reason for this was so that someone could rent out an entire floor. OK, but there must be a better way to accomplish this than by inconveniencing every other hotel guest -- for example, simply lock out the floor to anyone who doesn't have the proper key. Thus, unsure if the reason I was given was wrong but it was inconvenient to have to use two elevators every time I wanted to enter or exit the hotel. As others have said, the lobby is extremely small and is not a place to congregate. The lounge/bar is on the 24th floor. The lounge (black walls, low lights) is dark with very loud music. It obviously appeals to some but I would not say it is a place to relax. The only restaurant is a Wolfgang Puck Asian-style that I didn't try. However, the hotel is steps from many great restaurants so this isn't an issue. I did ask to take a glass of wine to my room; I was told they would have to give me a plastic cup! This is the very first hotel in which this has ever happened. I must add that I did voice my complaints to hotel management, which was very prompt and dutiful in following up with me, providing a measure of "compensation," and doing their best to address retroactively problems which really couldn't be resolved during my visit. Overall, I would recommend the Ritz if you have a downtown even and want a luxurious place to stay or for a romantic getaway WE. If you need to stay at LA Live for business, don't stay here until they upgrade the rooms to be ready for business travelers. The Marriott next door is not as luxurious, is more of a "commodity," and caters to conventions, but definitely is more geared to the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SFTravellers415
Reviews.Content: I really love the Ritz Carlton and was very excited about staying at the Ritz LA. It was surprisingly disappointing. The rooms were nice (but not that much nicer than your average new hotel). But, the reason that I love going to the Ritz isn't their rooms; it's the phenomenal service that you typically get. Unfortunately, we ended up getting bad service. At our favorite Ritz Carltons, the staff (particularly at the Club Level) are incredibly warm and friendly and go out of their way to make you feel special. Even at the average Ritz, the staff are always very professional and take their jobs seriously. But, here, most of the staff weren't friendly or accessible and actually made me feel unwelcome at times. It got so bad that I didn't want to go to the Club level after awhile (and I usually love the Club level). Not sure what's happening with their staffing. A bunch of times, I tried calling the main number and no one would even pick up the phone - not even a voicemail message. Again, very weird. On my last night, the Club manager stopped by the table where I was sitting and asked how things were going. I mentioned that I was disappointed compared with stays at other Ritz Carltons. She seemed really nice and took down my information, promising to email me right away (I gave her my contact information, at her request, because she seemed genuinely interested and concerned). Then, she never emailed - again, really strange. Seems like the hotel may be going through some serious growing pains. Such a shame. I really do love the Ritz . But for the first time ever, the staff at a Ritz made my stay kind of unpleasant, and it's hard justifying paying these rates at a hotel where you feel unwelcome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: West2EastandBack
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the new Ritz Carlton LA for a weekend with my six year old son. The room was spacious, very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was fantastic. The rain shower and bath tub were both behind one glass door, and the bathroom TV was cleverly embedded in the vanity mirror...both features very cool. Pool was fairly warm and located on a rooftop, so the view was beautiful and nearly 360 degrees. Room service food was yummy. Service is what you'd expect from a Ritz Carlton, and everyone made my son feel welcome. I've stayed at many LA hotels, i think this one is my new favorite.
